title: AB 1228
content: The State of California enacts the following. The State of California enacts amendments to the Education Code to encourage dissemination of information to foster care agencies by higher education institutions and explore admissions methods for homeless and foster youth. Each campus of the California Community Colleges is requested to prioritize housing for current and former homeless youth and foster youth in student housing facilities, especially during school breaks or on a year-round basis. Each campus of the California Community Colleges is asked to prioritize housing for current and former homeless youth and foster youth in student housing facilities, giving them first priority for year-round residence at no extra cost. Each campus of the California Community Colleges is requested to develop a plan to ensure that current and former homeless youth and foster youth can access housing resources as needed, regardless of whether the campus maintains student housing facilities. A "homeless youth" under 25 years old, verified as homeless within 24 months before applying to a California Community College, can access housing resources. A homeless youth under 25 years old, verified as homeless within 24 months before applying to a California Community College, can access housing resources. The eligibility criteria include being verified as a former homeless youth by a homeless services provider, the director of a federal TRIO program or Gaining Early Awareness and Readiness for Undergraduate Programs program, or a financial aid administrator. The status as a former homeless youth is retained for six years from the date of admission. Each campus of the California State University with student housing facilities must prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for housing. Each campus of the California State University must prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for residence in housing facilities, providing housing at no extra cost during academic breaks and giving priority based on the number of days the housing is available throughout the year. Each California State University campus is requested to develop a plan to ensure homeless and foster youth have access to housing resources during academic breaks, regardless of student housing availability. Each University of California campus with student housing facilities must prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for housing. Priority is given for year-round residence in housing facilities open during school breaks. Each University of California campus with student housing facilities must prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for year-round residence at no extra cost during academic breaks. The University of California campuses prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for year-round residence at no extra cost, giving them priority for housing facilities open for occupation for the most days in the calendar year. Additionally, a UC campus is asked to create a plan for homeless and foster youth to access housing resources during academic terms and breaks, regardless of student housing availability. A "homeless youth" under 25 years old, verified as homeless within the past 24 months, is defined for admission to a University of California campus. The section defines who can verify a student as a former homeless youth, including a homeless services provider, the director of certain federal programs, and a financial aid administrator. A student verified as a former homeless youth retains that status for six years from admission, with the University of California exempt unless the Regents choose to apply the section.
